subject: Management
title: The Two-Minute Rule for Small Calls
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Two-Minute Rule for Small Calls.

hook.text: A manager agonized for an hour over which meeting room to book for the all-hands.

buildup.text: Small decisions pile up and steal energy from the ones that actually matter.

discovery.text: David Allen's rule: if it takes less than two minutes to decide, decide now.

twist.text: The cumulative cost of postponed small decisions is bigger than any single one of them.

climax.text: Create defaults: always pick the first open slot, the cheaper option, the shorter meeting.

punchline.text: Trivial choices don't deserve serious thought.

quiz.question: What is the two-minute rule for decisions?
options: If it takes less than two minutes to decide, decide immediately
Spend at least two minutes analyzing every decision
Only delegate decisions that take under two minutes
